Posted By: Pontiac (4/12/2011 12:34:25 PM)

posts.post_content:
For all the comments saying how it was 3X worse that black lotus and how there are so few cards that give 0CMC mana ramp, just look at the power 9: [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) which is 0 CMC mana ramp, [Mox Ruby](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Ruby), [Mox Emerald](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Emerald), [Mox Pearl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Pearl), [Mox Jet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Jet) and [Mox Sapphire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Sapphire) which are all 0 CMC mana ramp. What are thought of as almost the nine most powerful cards in the game, 6 of are 0 CMC mana ramp.  
  
on a final note, all the moxes give one mana of a specific colour each turn, Lotus Petal gives one mana of any colour for one turn, if you're playing a combo deck that wins on turn one, you don't care about that.
posts.html:
For all the comments saying how it was 3X worse that black lotus and how there are so few cards that give 0CMC mana ramp, just look at the power 9: Black Lotus which is 0 CMC mana ramp, Mox Ruby, Mox Emerald, Mox Pearl, Mox Jet and Mox Sapphire which are all 0 CMC mana ramp. What are thought of as almost the nine most powerful cards in the game, 6 of are 0 CMC mana ramp.

on a final note, all the moxes give one mana of a specific colour each turn, Lotus Petal gives one mana of any colour for one turn, if you're playing a combo deck that wins on turn one, you don't care about that.

Posted By: Arrzarr (7/12/2011 1:38:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It is only a third of Black Lotus' power.  
  
Black lotus was about 6 times too powerful.  
  
There are virtually no 0 CMC mana accelerators. This is for good reason, it's because it breaks the entire structure of the game. There are only so many things you can do on the first turn, and most of them cost 0 or 1 mana.  
With one or two of these in your starter hand, it's like you skipped the first turn of the game, while your opponent didn't.  
  
Burn decks would be helped, but it also helps to play a 2/2 with haste and vigilance on the first turn, preventing your opponent form doing anything useful on the first or second turn.  
  
Again, it just speeds you up relative to your opponent, and you can spend your extra time and mana gaining card advantage.
posts.html:

With one or two of these in your starter hand, it's like you skipped the first turn of the game, while your opponent didn't.

Burn decks would be helped, but it also helps to play a 2/2 with haste and vigilance on the first turn, preventing your opponent form doing anything useful on the first or second turn.

Again, it just speeds you up relative to your opponent, and you can spend your extra time and mana gaining card advantage.

Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Aaron:  
[Lotus Pedal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Pedal) was never broken, but it enables other broken cards and makes them even more broken. [Tolarian Academy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tolarian Academy) for example was a sure hit and I wonder why NO designer was able to stop this sillyness before it happens.  
  
To make the Lotus Pedal safe, it should enter the battlefield tapped. Most problems fixed, since it can fix your mana, but it can't be used to cast a [Flash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flash) on turn 1.
posts.html:

To make the Lotus Pedal safe, it should enter the battlefield tapped. Most problems fixed, since it can fix your mana, but it can't be used to cast a Flash on turn 1.

Posted By: Cheza (8/1/2011 5:41:52 AM)

posts.post_content:
Mr. Forsythe,  
  
I would like to point out that some of these "poke the bear" cards do come out reasonable without being let downs. I would consider Gilded Lotus, Mox Opal, Ancestral Visions, Lotus Bloom, and Time Warp are all examples of throwbacks which are at once exciting, powerful, and pretty balanced. Chrome Mox really pushes the envelope but still seems fair enough all things considered.  
  
I think all people like a well-designed throwback, and as a huge huge huge fan of Time Spiral from a design, creative, limited, and constructed stand point, I love throwbacks. Never stop doing 'em!

posts.post_content:
**Aaron’s Random Card Comment of the Day #51, 1/4/11**   
   
As a designer/developer, I find it fun to poke the bear. By that I mean revisit some generally-accepted taboo and try to make a version that is printable and fun. If “draw-sevens” are considered unprintable, I want to make one. If random discard is considered out of bounds, I want to reprint [Hypnotic Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hypnotic Specter) ([Hymn to Tourach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hymn to Tourach) was the real problem).
  
   
Other people that worked here prior to me must have enjoyed the forbidden fruit as well, as can be seen on Lotus Petal, originally printed in *Tempest*.
  
   
It was common there, probably considered cute and/or weak by the development teams of that era. Yet here we are, a dozen years later, and Lotus Petal is on the Vintage Restricted List and we’re commemorating its power by including it in *From the Vault*.
  
   
I can see why they thought this card was safe to print. Yes, [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) is insanely powerful, but ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Aaron’s Random Card Comment of the Day #51, 1/4/11

As a designer/developer, I find it fun to poke the bear. By that I mean revisit some generally-accepted taboo and try to make a version that is printable and fun. If “draw-sevens” are considered unprintable, I want to make one. If random discard is considered out of bounds, I want to reprint Hypnotic Specter (Hymn to Tourach was the real problem).

Other people that worked here prior to me must have enjoyed the forbidden fruit as well, as can be seen on Lotus Petal, originally printed in Tempest.

It was common there, probably considered cute and/or weak by the development teams of that era. Yet here we are, a dozen years later, and Lotus Petal is on the Vintage Restricted List and we’re commemorating its power by including it in From the Vault.

I can see why they thought this card was safe to print. Yes, Black Lotus is insanely powerful, but ... (see all)

posts.post_content:
This is only broken when thrown into a deck with broken cards.  
  
Throw it into any Joe Blows deck... and its a 2 for 1 magnet. Same story with big daddy [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus)... true story.  
  
Examples:  
T1 Mountain  
T1 Plains + This + [White Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=White Knight) ((([Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock))))  
  
T1 Island  
T1 Swamp + [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) + [Hypnotic Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hypnotic Specter) + [Unholy Strength](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unholy Strength) (([Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon)))  
  
  
On magic tactics, I like seeing opponents drop Black Lotus, immediately thinking 2 for 1 time... True Story.
